marks:
Signature, Date and Inscription

On verso: [\"Far LL in black: [Alex Fournier, June 2.\'88]
provenance:
Edmund E. Bates, Minneapolis, Minnesota;[1] purchased by MIA in 1944.

[1] Various correspondence and memos dated throughout 1944 indicated that the painting was initially offered for sale to General Mills, Inc., who turned the work down. Edmund Bates worked for the General Casualty Company, Minneapolis; in one letter he mentions that his brother, Gordon Bates, owns four or five similar 'Minneapolis' pictures by Fournier (see 'Lowry Hill, Minneapolis', 50.14).
text:
Farnham's Mill was one of the earliest mills established in Minneapolis.  It lay on the west side of Hennepin Island at the east end of St. Anthony Falls.

Fournier was one of the first local artists in Minnesota.  He was born in St. Paul and studied both in this country and at the Julien Academy in France.
title: Farnham's Mill at St. Anthony Falls, Minneapolis
